medical_history.chief_complaint: Dizziness, anorexia, dry mouth, increased thirst, frequent urination, dysphagia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began several days prior to the visit, initially presenting with dizziness, anorexia, dry mouth, increased thirst, and frequent urination. The patient had fever and reported food would 'get stuck' while swallowing. She also experienced continued weakness and dizziness despite increased fluid intake. Symptoms worsened with orthostatic hypotension noted during follow-up.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Cutaneous lupus, hyperlipidemia, osteoporosis, frequent urinary tract infections, primary hypothyroidism diagnosed the prior year, three uncomplicated cesarean sections, and a left oophorectomy for a benign cyst.
medical_history.family_history: Oral and bladder cancer in mother, Gravesâ€™ disease in two sisters, hemochromatosis in one sister, idiopathic thrombocytopenic purpura in one sister.
medical_history.social_history: 20-pack-year history of smoking (quit 3 weeks before presentation), no alcohol or drug abuse, lives with husband and has three healthy adult children.
